subject: Programming
title: How Sound Becomes Data
description: A 60-second lesson on How Sound Becomes Data.

hook.text: Sound is a wave. Computers can't store waves â€” only numbers. So they sample.

buildup.text: Sampling measures the wave's height thousands of times per second and records each value.

discovery.text: CD audio samples 44,100 times per second. Each sample is a 16-bit number.

twist.text: Between samples, the wave's exact shape is lost. Higher sample rates capture more but cost more space.

climax.text: Music, podcasts, and voice calls are all reconstructions from tiny numeric snapshots.

punchline.text: You're listening to numbers played back as waves.

quiz.question: How many times per second does CD audio sample sound?
